001package imagingbook.lib.math.nonlinear;
002
003import static java.lang.Math.cos;
004import static java.lang.Math.exp;
005import static java.lang.Math.sin;
006import static org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresFactory.model;
007
008import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateMatrixFunction;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateVectorFunction;
010import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.GaussNewtonOptimizer;
011import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresFactory;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresOptimizer;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresOptimizer.Optimum;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresProblem;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.optim.SimpleVectorValueChecker;
019
020import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
021import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
022
023/**
024 * Static utility methods for simplified access to nonlinear least-squares
025 * solvers in Apache Commons Math.
026 * Hides much of the available configuration options.
027 * If other than default settings are needed, the original API should be used.
028 * 
029 * TODO: Needs cleanup and tests.
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 *
033 */
034public abstract class NonlinearLeastSquares {
035        
036        public static int MaxEvaluations = 1000;
037        public static int MaxIterations = 1000;
038        public static double Tolerance = 1e-6;
039        
040        /**
041         * Solves the nonlinear least-squares problem defined by the arguments.
042         * Delegates to the Levenberg-Marquardt method.
043         * 
044         * @param V the "value" function, V(p) must return a vector for the current parameters p
045         * @param J the "Jacobian" function, J(p) must return a matrix for the current parameters p
046         * @param z the vector of observed ("target") values
047         * @param p0 initial parameter vector
048         * @return the vector of optimal parameters
049         */
050        public static RealVector solveNLS(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
051                        RealVector z, RealVector p0) {
052                return solveLevenvergMarquardt(V, J, z, p0);
053        }
054        
055        /**
056         * Solves the nonlinear least-squares problem defined by the arguments
057         * using Levenberg-Marquardt optimization.
058         * 
059         * @param V the "value" function, V(p) must return a vector for the current parameters p
060         * @param J the "Jacobian" function, J(p) must return a matrix for the current parameters p
061         * @param z the vector of observed ("target") values
062         * @param p0 initial parameter vector
063         * @return the vector of optimal parameters
064         */
065        public static RealVector solveLevenvergMarquardt(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
066                                                RealVector z, RealVector p0) {
067                LeastSquaresProblem problem = makeProblem(V, J, z, p0);
068                LeastSquaresOptimizer optimizer = new LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer();
069                Optimum solution = optimizer.optimize(problem);
070                //System.out.println("iterations = " + solution.getIterations());
071                return solution.getPoint();
072        }
073        
074        /**
075        * Solves the nonlinear least-squares problem defined by the arguments
076         * using Gauss-Newton optimization.
077         * 
078         * @param V the "value" function, V(p) must return a vector for the current parameters p
079         * @param J the "Jacobian" function, J(p) must return a matrix for the current parameters p
080         * @param z the vector of observed ("target") values
081         * @param p0 initial parameter vector
082         * @return the vector of optimal parameters
083         */
084        public static RealVector solveGaussNewton(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
085                                                RealVector z, RealVector p0) {
086                LeastSquaresProblem problem = makeProblem(V, J, z, p0);
087                LeastSquaresOptimizer optimizer = new GaussNewtonOptimizer();
088                Optimum solution = optimizer.optimize(problem);
089                //System.out.println("iterations = " + solution.getIterations());
090                return solution.getPoint();
091        }
092        
093        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
094        
095        private static LeastSquaresProblem makeProblem(MultivariateVectorFunction V, MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
096                                        RealVector observed, RealVector start) {        
097                return LeastSquaresFactory.create(model(V, J), observed, start,
098                        LeastSquaresFactory.evaluationChecker(new SimpleVectorValueChecker(Tolerance, Tolerance)),
099                        MaxEvaluations, MaxIterations);
100        }
101        
102        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
103        // book version
104        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
105        
106        public static RealVector solveNLS2(
107                        MultivariateVectorFunction V, 
108                        MultivariateMatrixFunction J, 
109                        RealVector z, RealVector p0) 
110        {
111                LeastSquaresProblem problem = 
112                                LeastSquaresFactory.create(model(V, J), z, p0, null,
113                                                MaxEvaluations, MaxIterations);
114                LeastSquaresOptimizer optimizer = new LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer();
115                Optimum solution = optimizer.optimize(problem);
116//              System.out.println("iterations = " + solution.getIterations());
117                if (solution.getIterations() > MaxIterations)
118                        return null;
119                else 
120                        return solution.getPoint();
121        }
122        
123        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
124
125        private static RealVector makeTargetVector(double[][] data) {
126                int n = data.length;
127                RealVector target = new ArrayRealVector(n);
128                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
129                        target.setEntry(i, data[i][1]);
130                }
131                return target;
132        }
133
134        public static void main(String[] args) {
135                PrintPrecision.set(6);
136                
137                // 1D fitting example in book appendix: f(x) = exp(-a * x) * sin(b * x) + c
138                double[][] data = {{3, 2.5}, {6, 1.7}, {8, 2.5}, {8, 2.3}, {15, 2.1}}; // (xi, yi)
139                
140                final int n = data.length;
141                final int k = 3;                                // number of parameters
142                
143                MultivariateVectorFunction V = new MultivariateVectorFunction() {
144                        @Override
145                        public double[] value(double[] p) {
146                                double[] V = new double[n];
147                                double a = p[0];
148                                double b = p[1];
149                                double c = p[2];
150                                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
151                                        double x = data[i][0];
152                                        V[i] = exp(-a * x) * sin(b * x) + c;
153                                }
154                                return V;
155                        }
156                };
157                
158                MultivariateMatrixFunction J = new MultivariateMatrixFunction() {
159                        @Override
160                        public double[][] value(double[] p) {
161                                double[][] J = new double[n][k];
162                                double a = p[0];
163                                double b = p[1];
164//                              double c = p[2];
165                                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {                   
166                                        double x = data[i][0];
167                                        J[i][0] = -exp(-a * x) * x * sin(b * x); // df(x)/da
168                                        J[i][1] =  exp(-a * x) * x * cos(b * x); // df(x)/db
169                                        J[i][2] = 1;                                                     //     df(x)/dc
170                                }
171                                return J;
172                        }
173                };
174                
175                RealVector z = makeTargetVector(data);
176                RealVector p0 = new ArrayRealVector(new double[] {0,1,2});
177                {
178                        RealVector popt = solveLevenvergMarquardt(V, J, z, p0);
179                        System.out.println("Levenberg:    popt = " + Matrix.toString(popt.toArray()));
180                }
181                {
182                        RealVector popt = solveGaussNewton(V, J, z, p0);
183                        System.out.println("Gauss-Newton:    popt = " + Matrix.toString(popt.toArray()));
184                }
185                {
186                        MaxIterations = 10;
187                        RealVector popt = solveNLS2(V, J, z, p0);
188                        System.out.println("solveNLS2 (LM): popt = " + Matrix.toString(popt.toArray()));
189                }
190        }
191}
